entities.name: gryffindor
entities.description: The team led by Harry Potter, mentioned as being in possession of thirty points and later increasing their lead to fifty points.

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: The opposing team that is enraged at Gryffindor's early lead and resorts to any means to take the Quaffle.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The player leading Gryffindor in the game, mentioned as soaring over the match looking for the Snitch.

entities.name: alicia
entities.description: A student who is hit by Bole with his club and later said to be a Bludger.

entities.name: bole
entities.description: A Slytherin player who hits Alicia with his club and tries to say she was a Bludger.

entities.name: madam hooch
entities.description: The teacher who awards both teams penalties during the game.

entities.name: wood
entities.description: A Gryffindor player who makes spectacular saves and is later caught by Bludgers in the stomach.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: A Slytherin student who keeps close to Harry as he soars over the match looking for the Snitch.

entities.name: katie
entities.description: A Gryffindor student who scores fifty points for her team.

entities.name: fred weasley
entities.description: A Gryffindor player who is mentioned as swooping around Katie with his club raised.

entities.name: george weasley
entities.description: A Gryffindor player who is mentioned as swooping around Katie with his club raised and later elbowed by Bole in the face.

relationships.description: Gryffindor is leading Slytherin in the game, with a score of thirty to ten.
Bole hits Alicia with his club and tries to say she was a Bludger.
George Weasley elbowed Bole in the face in retaliation for hitting Alicia.
Madam Hooch awards Gryffindor a penalty during the game.
Wood is caught by Bludgers in the stomach, one of which was aimed at him by Bole and Derrick.
Malfoy keeps close to Harry as he soars over the match looking for the Snitch.
Fred Weasley is mentioned as swooping around Katie with his club raised, in case any of the Slytherins were thinking of revenge.
George Weasley is mentioned as swooping around Katie with his club raised, in case any of the Slytherins were thinking of revenge.
